The story about Akasaka is not that they are three-fold, but three-layered=
. 
They are supposed to have been forged from two outer layers of harder 
s=
teel sandwiching a softer center. Reality is somewhat different with 
early=
 Akasaka guards showing an inconsistent variety of forging schemes 
and lay=
ering.

I've never run across any particular story or 
reality with the for=
ging of Owari guards. The good ones I've handled are 
quite tightly welded.=
  Visible layers in a guard are often the result 
of rust or fire. Voids in=
 the outer rim like that are rather suspect - I 
doubt that guards were let=
 out of the shop like that. But, it looks 
like it's in good condition othe=
rwise, so who knows.

Regarding the reference to an "Owari" guard in a KTK =
catalog...  I would approach 
those books with caution as reference materia=
l.
